body:
This bug was introduced in #10533.

Due to "system labels" getting filtered from any object https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/v3.13.0/pkg/storage/driver/secrets.go#L102, they are no longer available by the time the selection on `name=metrics-server` is attempted: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/v3.13.0/pkg/action/list.go#L191-L195.

issue.title: Adds labels support for install and upgrade commands

labels.name: size/XL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 500-999 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by the required number of approvers

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->
/closes https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/7007

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Adding support of providing custom labels during install/update of release that could be used for selector filtering introduced in https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/8532.


**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This PR focused on adding custom label support during install/upgrade actions.
There was similar PRs before that, unfortunately, haven't been finished: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/8546 https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/8099 https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/9087

In this PR I'm trying to make changes as small as possible, to make development and review easier.
My goal is to make selector functionality in the list command useable for install/upgrade actions with secret and configmap storage drivers.

I don't want to add SQL support in this particular PR, cause it seems it would at least double the number of changes.

TODO:
Functionality (support labels argument during following actions):
- [x] install
- [x] upgrade --install
- [x] upgrade (basic)
- [x] upgrade (keep labels on superseded releases)
- [x] tests for new functionality (don't know how to implement it better)
- [x] Secret storage driver
- [x] Configmap storage driver

Not planned in this PR:
- [x] SQL - support is not currently planned in this PR. But there are some related developments in https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/8546 that could be prepared as separate PR later.
- [x] Merge original release labels with upgrade labels

**UPD**:
Now I have implemented even features I haven't planned for this PR. So right now this PR is completely ready for review.

If you're interested why I've created a separate DB table (in SQL driver) for custom releases - my idea was that some day we may want to make release filtering on storage backend side (k8s and SQL support requests with filtering by labels/joined table). so I decided that it would be better to split it to a separate table instead of having it encoded somewhere in json, because data migration is always annoying.

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [x] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body: Reason the tests did not catch this is likely because it makes use of the in-memory driver which did not see the same changes as introduced to other drivers in the above PR.

issue.title: Label selector in list command no longer working

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
Hello,

In Helm versions prior to 3.13.1 (for example 3.12.3) it was possible to list Helm releases by label selector, for example by Helm release name.

If I install a simple chart like incubator/raw like this:
```
$ helm repo add incubator https://charts.helm.sh/incubator
"incubator" has been added to your repositories
$ helm upgrade -i raw incubator/raw
Release "raw" does not exist. Installing it now.
WARNING: This chart is deprecated
NAME: raw
LAST DEPLOYED: Sun Oct 22 15:44:47 2023
NAMESPACE: default
STATUS: deployed
REVISION: 1
TEST SUITE: None
```

If I then use label selector _name=raw_ using Helm 3.13.1 it does not find any the previously installed raw release:
```
$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.13.1", GitCommit:"3547a4b5bf5edb5478ce352e18858d8a552a4110", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.20.8"}
$ helm list -l name=raw
NAME	NAMESPACE	REVISION	UPDATED	STATUS	CHART	APP VERSION
$
```

However if I downgrade Helm to 3.12.3 then the raw release is found:

```
$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.12.3", GitCommit:"3a31588ad33fe3b89af5a2a54ee1d25bfe6eaa5e", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.20.7"
$ helm list -l name=raw
NAME	NAMESPACE	REVISION	UPDATED                                 	STATUS  	CHART    	APP VERSION
raw 	default  	1       	2023-10-22 15:44:47.089882209 +0200 CEST	deployed	raw-0.2.5	0.2.3      
$
```

Is this an intentional change or a bug?
